fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Given a sheaf \mathscr { O } of rings, we can define a subsheaf \mathscr { O } ^ \times consisting of the invertible elements, i.e. \Gamma (U, \mathscr { O } ^ \times ) = \Gamma (U, \mathscr { O } )^ \times. This is the subsheaf of units.
This can be equivalently expressed as a pullback of \mathscr { O } \times \mathscr { O } \xrightarrow {(f,g) \mapsto f g} \mathscr { O } and 1 \xrightarrow {1} \mathscr { O }.
